Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add HTTP transport support with SSE streaming

Implement full HTTP+SSE transport alongside existing STDIO transport,
enabling remote access and multi-client support.

## New Features

### Transport Layer
- HTTP server with Express
- Server-Sent Events (SSE) for streaming responses
- Dual transport support: STDIO (default) and HTTP (--http flag)

### Security & Middleware
- API key authentication with Bearer token
- CORS with wildcard pattern support
- Rate limiting (configurable)
- Security headers via Helmet
- Global error handling with JSON-RPC formatting

### HTTP Endpoints
- GET /mcp/v1/health - Health check
- GET /mcp/v1/info - Server information
- GET /mcp/v1/sse - SSE connection endpoint
- POST /mcp/v1/messages - JSON-RPC message endpoint

### SSE Connection Management
- Automatic heartbeat/keepalive
- Connection tracking and cleanup
- Broadcast capabilities
- Reconnection support

### Configuration
- Environment-based HTTP configuration
- Validation with helpful error messages
- Configurable: port, host, auth, CORS, rate limiting, SSE settings

## Implementation Details

### New Files
- src/config/http-config.ts - HTTP configuration management
- src/middleware/auth.ts - API key authentication
- src/middleware/security.ts - CORS, Helmet, rate limiting
- src/middleware/error-handler.ts - Global error handling
- src/transport/sse-manager.ts - SSE connection management
- src/transport/http-transport.ts - HTTP transport adapter
- src/server/http-server.ts - Express server setup

### Modified Files
- src/index.ts - Transport selection and HTTP mode support
- package.json - HTTP dependencies and new scripts
- README.md - Comprehensive HTTP transport documentation
- .env.example - HTTP configuration examples

### Dependencies Added
- express - HTTP server
- cors - CORS middleware
- helmet - Security headers
- express-rate-limit - Rate limiting

## Usage

### STDIO Mode (default)
npm start

### HTTP Mode
npm run start:http

### With custom config
MCP_API_KEYS=your-key MCP_HTTP_PORT=3000 npm run start:http

## Documentation
- Complete HTTP setup guide in README
- API endpoint documentation
- Client configuration examples
- Deployment guides (systemd, Docker)
- Security best practices
